BULLETIN NO. 140 
UPDATE OF JIG BUSINESS PRINCIPLES 
25/11/2021 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Background: 
The JIG Business Principles were introduced in July 2014 to provide governance guidelines in key areas 
to help any operator to manage and reduce the potential liabilities and risks associated with conducting 
their business. They cover the topics of HSSE, Employees, Business Relationships, Business Integrity and 
Property & Financial Integrity. The Business Principles are tailored towards the activities of Joint Ventures 
but may be successfully adopted by any entity doing business on airports. 
 
Summary of Changes: 
This version of the Business Principles Manual (v1.3) has been updated in 3 areas: 
* Human Rights commitments resulting from the adoption of the United Nations Declaration of 
Human Rights. 
* Update to the requirements to comply with sanctions, export control and anti-boycott laws, now 
termed Trade Control Laws. The update includes a definition of and the requirement to take into 
account Related Parties of contractual counterparties. 
* Addition of a governance requirement for Information Security and Data Protection in a new 
Chapter 7. 
 
Documents to implement and maintain Business Principles: 
To accompany this update, all the documents associated with this subject have been updated and are 
available for JIG Members

Chapter 7. 
 
Documents to implement and maintain Business Principles: 
To accompany this update, all the documents associated with this subject have been updated and are 
available for JIG Members to download from the website at https://www.jig.org/standards-publications 
and can be accessed quickly by filtering for the "CP Business Principles" Category in the Policy & 
Governance tab. A short explanatory video is also available here. 
 
The full suite of Business Principles documents comprises: 
 
1. CP 7.01* Business Principles Manual - outlines the recommended contents of a Business 
Principles Manual that should be suitable for typical storage, hydrant and into-plane operations and 
provided a framework that should ensure the appropriate policies and procedures are in place in 
order to work ethically and in compliance with the law. 
2. CP 7.01A* JIG Standard JV Agreement Business Principles Clauses - contains standard form legal 
clauses that JV Participants can adopt in addition to the JIG Template JV Agreements to align with 
the latest guidelines of Business Principles. 
3. CP 7.01B Business Principles Manual Management Guidance on Intent and Application - a 
presentation training pack that provides guidance information for Management to assist them in

4. CP 7.01C Business Principles Annual Compliance Audit - this document sets out a number of 
audit questions to help the Site Manager produce an annual compliance statement confirming that 
the entity is complying with its own Business Principles. 
5. CP 7.01D Business Principles Manual - Review Form - this document can be used by JVs to 
complete a gap analysis against their existing business principles and policies. 
 
 
Note * - To make this set of documents easier to understand for new Users, the main document - Business 
Principles Manual - has been re-numbered CP7.01 and the accompanying adjustments to Standard JV Clauses is 
now numbered CP7.01A.
